evidence.text:
Person B: ...You look so beautiful, honey.
Person B: You do. You look so beautiful, so grown up. I just can’t believe I haven’t seen you in what, a year?
Person A: It’s pretty solitary, it’s not really a community.

Person B: Yeah but did someone say “Oh that’s hard. Being an artist, that’s really hard.” Did someone put that dumb sentence into your head?
Person B: Well, she’s not your actual parent, she may think she is, but working at a job that you don’t really love, that’s hard. When you know your calling is out there waiting for you. Money doesn’t make a boring job that much better. What does Lisa want you to do?
Person A: She thinks I’d be great at like, graphic design.
Person A: No.

Person A: Oh! Hey sweetie, oh my gosh.
Person A: Oh, you did. That’s so sweet, that means a lot to me that you came.

Person B: What is the point of that show? What was that? And why did you invite me? Maybe you thought I wouldn’t come? Or I don’t know-- I don’t know why I did come-- although I guess it’s because I just hoped-- I just wanted to know that it was worth it. That it was better than me after all.
Person A: What??
Person B: That you didn’t put this lame trash above me--
Person A: It’s not-- I disagree-- and plus, I didn’t put anything above you. I provided for you--
Person B: It wasn’t!!
Person A: I couldn’t afford help, Hannah--
Person A: I-- I-- was doing my best, I know-- I was just doing my best, Hannah-- if you can actually do what you love for thirty years, if you are fortunate enough to be passionate about your career--

Person B: Shelly--
Person A: I’m so sorry, Hannah. I am so sorry that you didn’t get what you wanted from me. If you can forgive me? Anytime? Anytime in your life? I would love that. But I can’t defend myself anymore, I just can’t.
